name: Logger
desc: An object for writing interpolated string messages to the unified logging system.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates a logger that writes to the default subsystem.

items.name: init(subsystem: String, category: String)
items.desc: Creates a logger using the specified subsystem and category.

items.name: init(OSLog)
items.desc: Creates a logger that writes to the specified log.

items.name: class OSLog
items.desc: A container of related log messages.

items.name: func log(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a message to the log.

items.name: func log(level: OSLogType, OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a message to the log using the specified log type.

items.name: struct OSLogType
items.desc: The various log levels that the unified logging system provides.

items.name: struct OSLogMessage
items.desc: An object that represents a log message.

items.name: func notice(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a message to the log using the default log type.

items.name: func debug(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a debug message to the log.

items.name: func trace(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a trace message to the log.

items.name: func info(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes an informative message to the log.

items.name: func error(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes information about an error to the log.

items.name: func warning(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes information about a warning to the log.

items.name: func fault(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a message to the log about a bug that occurs when your app executes.

items.name: func critical(OSLogMessage)
items.desc: Writes a message to the log about a critical event in your appâ€™s execution.
